hints.content: Let's count how many locations had a rainfall of $3\text{ cm}$.

One location, Albany, measured $\greenE{3}\text{ cm}$  

So, we place $1$ dot over $\greenE{3}$ on the number line.  

![](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/19f203f6819edda6ee0b75b73de1c15417eb1577)
Now, let's graph the other measurements on the table.

Here is the completed line plot:

![](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/1388cc48a4da27691fe831ddfee7d60890220151)

question.content:
The amount of rainfall was measured in each city.   A weather woman is going to make a line plot of the data.  

Location | Rainfall ($\text{cm}$)
:-: | :-: | :-:
New York | $4$
Rochester | $6$
Albany | $3$
Buffalo | $4$
Syracuse | $5$

**Graph the measurements from the table on the line plot.**   
*Click above the line plot to make dots for each of the measurements.*

[[â˜ƒ plotter 1]]
